intro: Torrubia graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered torrubia, is a rare and delicate shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, elongated leaves and pale pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in shaded woodland areas. It is known for its compact growth habit and is often found in montane and submontane regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
